Key Match Events: Derrick White scored 26 points, shooting 5-of-10 both from inside and outside the arc.
White grabbed two rebounds, handed out two assists, and blocked two shots in 37 minutes of action.
White limited Anthony Edwards to 15 points on 5-of-16 shooting, including 2-for-9 from 3-point range.
White scored 13 points in the fourth quarter, including a fadeaway bank-shot dagger that put Boston ahead by eight points with two minutes remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston's head coach Joe Mazzulla praised Derrick White for his ability to impact the game whether heavily involved on offense or not.
White expressed in a postgame interview that he hadn't been pleased with his recent performances but felt he regained his confidence in this game.
Mazzulla emphasized reminding White of his greatness to help him overcome shooting struggles.
